page.title: 03Rivers, Lochs and Burns.
page.content: In the 12 square km we are researching there are lots of burns, rivers and lochs.The burns are Dead Burn and Kirk Burn.The rivers are the Cample and Templand River. Other names are Curling pond, New Loch,Black Ford and Gullet Spout. The Crichope Burn runs for about half a mile flat and then goes over a waterfall called the above mentioned Gullet Spout.It also has very deep pools.In the Cample you can catch salmon,burn trout and sea trout.New Loch got its name because it was a New Morton Loch but through the years it has been used for curling. It has shrunk over the years.Dead Burn runs into Crichope. Hells Cauldron, Barleys Leap Souters Seat are all deep pools in Crichope burn.The mill dams were used in the old days.They were used for power made by dams and water wheels.
